items.title: Committee Meeting Summary - July 11 2020
items.summary: T minus 43 days to Planet Music Camp and the excitement is mounting! On the agenda…
items.content_html:
T minus 43 days to Planet Music Camp and the excitement is mounting! On the agenda for sure are:

  • Ubi Caritas (opening and closing)
  • Daily prayer message from the Deans
  • Holy Motion led by Ruth Anne
  • Crafts
  • Bible Study
  • Photo Scavenger Hunt
  • Banjo Workshop
  • Relaxation
  • Basic Theory and Ear Training
  • Social Stitching (for all the crocheters, knitters, and other crafty people)
  • How to Prepare a Score for Rehearsal
  • Classical Guitar
  • Worship
  • Storytime
  • Campfire
  • ‘Live’ Band Karaoke
  • Coffee House/Variety Night
  • Hangouts for different groups
  • Tuck – yes there will be tuck!

There might be a few other things that we are still finalizing.

Planet Music Camp will be active from Ubi Caritas on Sunday August 23 at 7:00 pm EDT to the Daily Prayer Message, Sunday August 30 at 6:30 am EDT. (The prayer message will be on You Tube and you can see it later – you don’t have to get up at 6:30!!)

The finished schedule should be ready soon. We kept most activities in the early morning, lunch time or evening in case you have a day job. 

We will use 4 platforms in various ways:

  • Zoom for the live events and some pre-recorded things;
  • You Tube for most pre-recorded events (with live texting for some You Tube events)
    • These will be on a private You Tube channel
  • Discord for Hangouts, and communication about events
  • Good old email 

We have a couple of things to remind you about:

  • Please use your real name on the platforms, rather than a screen name or nickname. There will be a waiting room on Zoom, and we won’t let you in if we don’t know who you are. 
  • If you are inviting a friend, please let us know so we will recognize the name.

Your Planet Music Camp Planning Committee

items.title: Committee Meeting Summary - June 20 2020
items.summary: We’ve started a draft schedule for Planet Music Camp, and we have so many great…
items.content_html:
We’ve started a draft schedule for Planet Music Camp, and we have so many great ideas in development – things like:

  • Videos that you can view anytime (Planet Music Camp selfies);
  • Pre-recorded scheduled activities (Holy Motion, Storytime);
  • Live events (Karaoke Night, Campfire, and hangouts);
  • And of course, some musical workshops.

There are 4 messages today:

  • Dates for Planet Music Camp.
  • More information on the PMC website soon.
  • Some of the activities will use Zoom. We are still testing other platforms and will have more information soon.
  • This year is a great opportunity for OUTREACH; no big commitment, and no expense.

Things to do RIGHT NOW:

  1. Mark your calendar, update your phone, and create some sticky notes for Planet Music Camp, August 23-30.
  2. Find the new PMC Website and BOOKMARK it - https://www.presbyterianmusiccamp.ca
  3. Try out Zoom. Have a Zoom meeting with a friend so you know the ropes. The basic version of Zoom is free to download and use. If you have trouble, ask the youngest person in your bubble for help. And if you’re still having trouble, reach out to the committee. We want to be sure that everyone can participate.
  4. Think about someone that you can share PMC with. This might be someone in your social circle, or a friend that you’ve wanted to invite to camp. Talk to that person about PMC and our plans for this year. (If you are feeling efficient, you can combine #3 and #4.)

Your Planet Music Camp Planning Committee

items.title: Committee Meeting Summary - June 6 2020
items.summary: Planet Music Campis coming to your device August 23-30!! The goal of Planet Music Camp is to…
items.content_html:
Planet Music Camp

is coming to your device August 23-30!!

The goal of Planet Music Camp is to keep our community connected until we can meet in person again. The theme for Planet Music Camp will develop organically – it will be fun to see what happens!

Just to give you lots of warning, there will be NO virtual tuck time at Planet Music Camp. Astronaut food and Tang are available on Amazon, but the shipping charges would be a problem.

DON’T DESPAIR – there are lots of other ideas on the virtual table. Right now, we are developing the most promising ideas, and on June 20 we will determine the activities to implement.

Starting in early July, we’ll be sending you information like:

  • The schedule for Planet Music Camp;
  • Details about the platform(s) we will use;
  • Details (as available) about the activities and events;
  • Requests for email addresses so we can include you in events;
  • Information on how to register for virtual workshops so we’ll be sure to include you.

We are bravely going where no Planet Music Camp Committee has gone before, and we are concerned about taking on too much, so there may not be the variety you are used to. We hope you will find something that excites you among the activities we’ll offer.

You may also get phone calls or emails from workshop leaders with specific questions for you.

We’re excited about this adventure – we hope you’ll join us for the journey.

Your Planet Music Camp Planning Committee

items.title: Committee Meeting Summary - May 23 2020
items.summary: You have probably heard the sad news already… there will be no in-person music camp…
items.content_html:
You have probably heard the sad news already… there will be no in-person music camp in 2020. This hard decision was taken out of our hands by the Government of Ontario. They understand the importance of summer camps, but this year it just wasn’t safe to go ahead.

We have emailed all currently registered campers, and campers from 2017, 2018, and 2019, and also have a video message available:

https://www.presbyterianmusiccamp.ca/this-year.html

We understand that this will be very hard for our camp community. PMC is seen by many as the end of one year and the start of the next. You may be feeling angry), incredulous), or even a bit depressed. The PMC Committee shares these feelings (and many more), and we are still working on accepting that “camp” will be a different sort of experience this year.

However…there is a silver lining:

  • Our friends at Camp Tamarack (Rick, Ellen, and Marc) are optimistic that they will
    survive and thrive, and they are looking forward to hosting us again in 2021.
  • The PMC Committee will continue to work on the administrative issues (constitution,
    charitable status, emergency procedures, and more) so we will be in great shape for
    camp in 2021.
  • We have started thinking about some virtual activities for 2020 to keep our community
    engaged and active. You’ll hear more about these as the plans develop.

So, hold that time at the end of August, and watch for more news from us,

Your PMC Committee

items.title: Committee Meeting Summary - May 2 2020
items.summary: The PMC Committee spent time over the past 2 weeks creating a video! Check out…
items.content_html:
The PMC Committee spent time over the past 2 weeks creating a video! Check out our results at:

https://youtu.be/0ALK-clfcRA

Virtual meetings continue as we plan for PMC 2020. We remain committed to providing the best possible PMC experience, and are in close contact with Camp Tamarack, Cairn, and the Ontario Camps Association as we navigate this strange new world.

You have recently received a request from our Deans, David Linderman and Hugh Donnelly, for volunteers for evening worship. If you are interested in leading an evening worship, please respond soon so David and Hugh can plan.

And we still work away at the administrative issues: the Constitution for PMC, Emergency Procedures, and the Wiki.

items.title: Committee Meeting Summary - March 2020
items.summary: The PMC Committee has started to talk about the issues that COVID-19 presents. One thing that…
items.content_html:
The PMC Committee has started to talk about the issues that COVID-19 presents.
 
One thing that would help the PMC committee in our discussions is knowing if you would attend PMC 2020 if the situation allows. With that in mind:
  • If you intend to come to camp, please register right away so we will know our numbers
  • Please do NOT pay now
  • We are discussing our cancellation policy, and more information will be available soon
  • We all know that this situation is ongoing and so are our discussions. Our guiding principles are:
    • we want everyone to be healthy and safe; 
    • we want to support our camp community during this time; 
    • we want to maximize flexibility for decision making for everyone – our committee, our campers; and Tamarack; 
    • we want Tamarack to make it through this; 
    • we don’t want campers to suffer undue financial hardship; 
    • we want PMC to survive and thrive.
Your PMC Committee

items.title: Committee Meeting Summary - April 2020
items.summary: The ABCs of planning camp: We have a Plan A and a Plan B so we can plan for COVID-19. In Plan A,…
items.content_html:
The ABCs of planning camp:

We have a Plan A and a Plan B so we can plan for COVID-19.

In Plan A, PMC goes ahead as scheduled. We continue to recruit leaders for workshops, draft schedules, and plan evening activities. COVID-19 will impact us to some extent, but our community can work with whatever restrictions the Muskoka Public Health Unit advises.

In Plan B, PMC will go on in a different way. We are still hoping to avoid this, but the optimism of 3 weeks ago is not as strong today. We plan to make a definite decision by the end of May – if the government doesn’t beat us to it!

We are also making progress on the administrative issues related to our status as a Registered Charity.

AND – we have a new Wiki (which I have learned comes from Hawaiian "wiki-wiki" which means "quick" – thanks Lois!). This resource will prevent the committee from reinventing the wheel as membership evolves.

PMC is a community, and we are stronger together.  If you are coping with illness, job loss, financial burdens, separation, loneliness, anxiety, boredom, depression…know that we are with you in spirit and praying for you. We are all in this together!

items.title: Committee Meeting Summary - January 2020
items.summary: Neither snow, nor rain, nor heat, nor gloom of night shall keep your PMC committee…
items.content_html:
Neither snow, nor rain, nor heat, nor gloom of night shall keep your PMC committee from staying on schedule.

Most importantly, we confirmed that the camp dates will NOT be changed – PMC 2020 will be August 23-30 as planned.

The theme for 2020 is

The long and dusty road: exploring life as a pilgrimage

If you immediately thought of the road at Tamarack, you don’t need an illustration. Sub-themes will include:

  • Pilgrimage in community
  • Pilgrimage that changes directions
  • Pilgrimage through the wilderness
  • Pilgrimage of baby steps
  • Pilgrimage of discipleship
  • Pilgrimage that we are never walking alone

Stay tuned as we develop these themes.

The new website is very close to ready – in fact, by the time you get this the website will likely be operational. You will be redirected automatically from musicamp.ca to the new site, presbyterianmusiccamp.ca. Check it out (and let us know if you find any issues – it’s a work in progress).

The new website won’t have 2020 fees until we finalize our HST plans and the Tamarack rates for 2020. We will have fees for 2020 available by the end of February (after our next meeting).

We spent time January 25 developing a draft schedule for PMC 2020. Your feedback on last year’s schedule was very helpful, and we are excited about some new workshops for 2020 – we just need to confirm leadership for all of these plans.

items.title: Committee Meeting Summary - November 2019
items.summary: Your PMC Committee met November 23 in beautiful Ashburn, Ontario. We’re really excited about the theme for…
items.content_html:
Your PMC Committee met November 23 in beautiful Ashburn, Ontario.

We’re really excited about the theme for 2020; as soon as artwork is ready, we’ll let you all know.

A big project for the next few months is the PMC Website. We are going to redesign the website and update the content to make it more attractive to and informative for potential new campers. Daniel Eisner will be leading this, with content help from Rae-Lyn Rosefield, Kaitlin Audet, Cynthia McMinn, Bradley Audet, and Lindsay Weidelich.

We also discussed and approved a financial incentive for new campers – ½ price camp! There are some limits and conditions for this, but we wanted to tell you early so you can persuade your family and friends to think about coming to camp in 2020. More information will follow.

Vic Lovatt has joined us as youth rep, Sarah Dupont is continuing work on scripts for promotional videos, and Anne Audet is looking into solving a cross-contamination issue for campers with food allergies/sensitivites.

Of course, we also discussed some more mundane things, like insurance,
safety plan, and the budget. Someone has to.

Finally, there is a great idea for fundraising in the works. Stay tuned for details of this – you won’t want to miss it.

items.title: Committee Meeting Summary - September 2019
items.summary: We are trying something new this year! After each committee meeting, we’ll send a brief…
items.content_html:
We are trying something new this year! After each committee meeting, we’ll send a brief summary to our camp community so you can see what we’re up to.

We had our first committee meeting on September 28. We welcomed several new PMC Committee members, and said thanks and farewell to a few others. Special thanks to our outgoing Deans, Sue Thompson and Kim Lovatt, and to our outgoing Convener Ruth Anne Robertson, as they transition to other (just as demanding) roles in their lives.

Mark your calendars!! Camp in 2020 will be August 23-30.

Welcome to David Linderman and Hugh Donnelly as Deans for 2020 and 2021. They have some great theme ideas – we’ll update you soon.

The PMC Committee for 2019-2020 is:
Conveners: Taras Broadhead and Cynthia McMinn
Treasurer: Debi Vanderstelt
Secretary: Alison Cooper
Registrar: Cathy Whiteside
Merchandise: Cathy Whiteside
Staffing: Jesse Fegelman and Kim Lovatt
Advertising: TBC
Website: Daniel Eisner
Camp Liaison: Anne Audet
Teen Rep: Lisa Broadhead
Cairn Reps: MJ Perry, Doug Kendall

Among the many things we talked about at the meeting were these highlights:

  • Planning is underway for new promotional videos for PMC, to use for introducing PMC to new campers. Sarah Dupont is working on scripts.
  • An improved agreement for sharing the Tamarack site with Camp Tournesol (the French camp); we are working on a plan to implement an improved agreement in 2020.
  • The future and role of Coffee House; we will consider this further as we plan for 2020.
  • We have the banner to fix over the winter (repairing the Great Mousecapade); Ian MacCready has the parts to fix the banner stand.

Want to make a joyful noise over the winter? It’s not too late to get a djembe to practice on your own, or to add “grace notes” to your Sunday service – contact MJ Perry or any committee member for information.

Look for our next update in early December for more information on these and other topics, including a possible teen retreat in the New Year. AND watch for a picture in Presbyterian Connection (check the PCC website for details).
